resources.string: if enabled, even if network location is available
Enter a place or a lat/long below

string.name: location_placename_hint
string.translation_description: An example address. Translators: please pick an address suitable for your country. If it has an astronomical connection (e.g. the address of an observatory or famous astronomer) then that would be even better.

resources.string: e.g. 1400 West Mars Hill Road, Flagstaff, AZ.

string.name: degrees
string.translation_description: angular degrees

resources.string: Auto-location permission is disabled on your phone. You can set the location manually in preferences. Until then the map will be incorrect.
Auto-location is disabled. Would you like to enable it?
Unable to decode your location - perhaps your network isn\'t available?

string.name: location_not_found
string.translation_description: dialog message when placename not found

resources.string: Place found. Setting latitude %1$f and longitude %2$f
Use knowledge of your location to correct orientation from magnetic north to true north

string.name: sensor_damping

resources.string: The sun will not set during the next 24 hours at your current location.
The sun will not rise during the next 24 hours at your current location.

string.name: missing_label
string.translation_description: Used to indicate to the developer that they've added a resource with no translation.

string.name: control_panel_btn
string.translation_description: Label for the control panel button

resources.string: Make Sky Map better by sending anonymous data to Google Analytics
Your device may lack orientation sensors - automode may not work

Unfortunately your device might not have one of the sensors that Sky Map needs.

 To show you the sky in the direction your phone is pointing Sky Map needs both a built-in compass and an accelerometer. Your device reports that it is missing one of them. The good news is that some devices (for example some Moto E phones) falsely claim not to have a compass but actually do.


If your device really is missing a sensor then auto-mode will not work. However, you can still use Sky Map on this device in manual mode where you drag, rotate and stretch the map with your fingers.
Do not show this message again
Why do we ask for your location?

The stars you can see depend on where on planet earth you are. Without your location we cannot show you an accurate map. If you do not want your phone to give us your location you can provide it manually in the settings. You need only provide the nearest city.
Warning: Google Play Services error - Automatic location might not work
Your compass may need to be calibrated

string.name: compass_calib_what_to_do
string.translation_description: Information for the user on how to calibrate the compass when the dialog auto-opens. Placeholder is the video URL

resources.string: Your phone is reporting to Sky Map that its internal compass is uncalibrated. This is not a Sky Map issue but we can help you try to fix it. To calibrate the compass try moving your phone in a figure of eight motion as demonstrated in this video %s until the accuracy reads \'high\'.

string.name: compass_calib_what_to_do_user
string.transation_description: Information for the user on how to calibrate the compass when they invoke the calibration dialog. Placeholder is the video URL

resources.string: Your phone\'s compass accuracy is shown above. If it is not \'high\' then the compass may need calibrating. This is not a Sky Map issue, but a property of your phone. To calibrate the compass try moving your phone in a figure of eight motion as demonstrated in this video %s.
Fix for phones with incorrectly implemented sensors - requires restart

Not all devices have a gyro - if yours does then you\'ll get better results with it enabled and this box unchecked. On the other hand if your device does not have a gyro then Sky Map will probably not work if you uncheck this box.
Rotate horizon by 90 degrees (for devices with forced landscape) or use pointer mode for the screen to show what the top of the phone is pointing at (see help text).
